channel.title: stdout security
channel.description:
Bite-sized, daily Cyber Security wrap-ups to get you prepped for your day.
Note: This is an AI-generated summary of News Articles from the past 24 hours. I take no credit for the research or analysis in said articles - this podcast only exists as a simple audio summary to help busy, sleep-deprivd Cyber Nerds like myself keep on top of developments while wranging kids and brushing teeth.
channel.author: Opalsec
channel.itunes:author: Opalsec
channel.itunes:summary: Bite-sized, daily Cyber Security wrap-ups to get you prepped for your day.

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, February 20, 2026
item.description:
**stdout: Daily Cyber Intelligence Briefing**

Stay ahead of the curve with "stdout", your essential daily briefing for Cyber Security Analysts. We cut through the noise, delivering critical insights on the last 24 hours of cyber developments.

üö® Active Threats & Breaches: Unpack the latest ransomware attacks on Japanese semiconductor supplier Advantest and the Booking.com phishing campaign targeting the hotel and retail sector. We delve into over $20 million stolen via ATM jackpotting, with over 700 incidents reported in 2025, the sentencing of a North Korea IT worker scheme facilitator, and Interpol's massive $4.3 million recovery operation. Plus, a supply chain attack on the Cline AI npm package, a Microsoft 365 Copilot bug exposing confidential emails, and the ongoing threat of China's Volt Typhoon embedded in US critical infrastructure. üá®üá≥

üõ†Ô∏è New Techniques & Exploited Vulnerabilities: Discover cutting-edge threats like PromptSpy, the first Android malware leveraging Google Gemini for persistence, and "Starkiller," a sophisticated Phishing-as-a-Service tool bypassing MFA. We analyse advanced LockBit 5.0 evasion tactics, the surge in RMM abuse (up 277% in 2025), and how threat actors are combining device code phishing with vishing to compromise Microsoft Entra accounts. Learn about new Remcos RAT variants, MetaMask wallet tampering via JavaScript backdoors, and the risks of Kerberos delegation for machine accounts. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

ü©π Critical Patches & Zero-Days: CISA mandates urgent patching for actively exploited vulnerabilities in Dell RecoverPoint (CVE-2026-22769) and Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340), with evidence of exploitation since summer 2025. We cover critical RCE flaws in Grandstream VoIP phones (CVE-2026-2329), OpenSSL stack buffer overflows, and 16 vulnerabilities (including zero-days) found in Foxit and Apryse PDF platforms. üí•

üåç Threat Landscape & Regulatory Watch: Get the lowdown on AI agent safety concerns, significant security risks in IoT devices, and a 49% increase in ransomware targeting industrial organisations in 2025. We also cover major data privacy exposures, regulatory actions against TP-Link, and Poland's ban on Chinese-made vehicles in military facilities. Stay informed on the push for post-quantum encryption transition and secure AI development. üá¶üá∫

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, February 16, 2026
item.description:
Dive into the latest cyber threats with stdout! üá¶üá∫ This episode unpacks the evolving 'ClickFix' social engineering tactic, a pervasive threat technique dominating the last 24 hours. We reveal how attackers are leveraging this method across diverse platforms and attack chains to compromise systems and exfiltrate sensitive data.

Discover a new DNS-based ClickFix attack targeting Windows, tricking users into executing nslookup commands to deploy ModeloRAT via a lightweight DNS staging channel. üíª Concurrently, Lumma Stealer activity surges, often delivered through fake CAPTCHA campaigns utilising CastleLoader and other resilient loaders like RenEngine and Hijack Loader. We also examine campaigns deploying StealC and Stealerium via PowerShell, and the novel abuse of generative AI services like Anthropic Claude to stage malicious ClickFix instructions, distributing Atomic Stealer and MacSync Stealer.

For macOS users, beware of phishing and malvertising delivering Odyssey Stealer, a full RAT exfiltrating data from over 200 browser and crypto wallets. üçé Attackers are also forging TCC authorisations via AppleScript and using fake Apple Support articles to steal credentials. A critical shift sees threat actors abusing Pastebin comments to promote fake crypto arbitrage exploits, injecting malicious JavaScript directly into browsers to hijack swap interfaces and steal cryptocurrency. Flare's analysis confirms macOS stealers overwhelmingly prioritises crypto theft, underscoring the urgent need for robust macOS-specific detection capabilities.

We also explore the ClearFake campaign's use of EtherHiding on compromised WordPress sites, deploying Lumma Stealer by executing contracts on the BNB Smart Chain. This innovative technique blends malicious traffic with legitimate Web3 activity, offering increased resilience. ‚õìÔ∏è Recognise the outdated and dangerous assumption that 'Macs don't get viruses' and understand the critical need for organisations to implement strong detection for macOS TTPs, including unsigned applications, unusual Terminal activity, and data exfiltration patterns.

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, February 15, 2026
item.description:
üö® Critical Alert: Dive into the latest cyber threats with stdout! We're tracking a single, sophisticated actor responsible for over 83% of recent attacks exploiting Ivanti EPMM zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2026-21962 & CVE-2026-24061). This threat actor, operating from bulletproof infrastructure, is also targeting Oracle WebLogic, GNU Inetutils Telnetd, and GLPI. Get the details on Ivanti's hotfixes and essential mitigation strategies for organisations.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Next, uncover the North Korean Lazarus Group's new 'Graphalgo' campaign. They're luring JavaScript and Python developers with fake job offers and malicious coding challenges that install a modular Remote Access Trojan (RAT) via legitimate package registries like npm and PyPi. This RAT is designed for extensive data exfiltration and specifically checks for MetaMask, indicating a strong focus on crypto-theft. Learn what to do if you've been affected.

‚úâÔ∏è Finally, beware of a cunning physical phishing campaign targeting Trezor and Ledger hardware wallet users. Threat actors are sending official-looking letters with QR codes leading to malicious sites designed to steal your recovery phrases. We explain how this leverages past data breaches and reiterate the golden rule: hardware wallet manufacturers will never ask for your recovery phrase online. Stay vigilant!

item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, February 14, 2026
item.description:
üö® This stdout episode unpacks a busy 24 hours in cyber security, diving into significant breaches and active campaigns. We cover Dutch telco Odido's breach affecting millions and luxury brands Louis Vuitton, Dior, and Tiffany fined for inadequate cloud security. Discover how suspected Russian intelligence is deploying CANFAIL malware against Ukrainian sectors using LLMs for reconnaissance, and how "ClickFix" campaigns leverage Claude LLM artefacts and Google Ads to deliver the MacSync infostealer to macOS users.

Explore new threat research, highlighting nation-state actors aggressively targeting the Defence Industrial Base with zero-day exploits and social engineering. Unpack the security risks of autonomous AI agents in "swarm" orchestrations, from credential sprawl to over-privileged access, and get the lowdown on npm's authentication overhaul and its lingering MFA phishing risks. Plus, Microsoft faces pressure over Bring-Your-Own-Vulnerable-Driver attacks and declines to classify new Windows LNK shortcut spoofing as vulnerabilities.

Stay ahead with critical vulnerability alerts: a pre-authentication RCE in BeyondTrust Remote Support (CVE-2026-1731) is actively exploited, alongside two critical RCE zero-days in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) compromising European government agencies. Apple's first 2026 zero-day (CVE-2026-20700) affecting iPhones/iPads, and a critical SQL injection flaw in Microsoft Configuration Manager (CVE-2024-43468) are also under active exploitation. Patch immediately!

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, February 13, 2026
item.description:
🔥 Your daily deep dive into the latest in infosec! This stdout episode analyses critical developments from the last 24 hours, focusing on active breaches, emerging attack techniques, and exploited zero-days.

💥 Active Breaches & Ransomware:

  • Dutch mobile provider Odido suffers a cyberattack, exposing 6.2 million customer records including names, bank details, and addresses.
  • Senegal grapples with "The Green Blood Group" ransomware, which exfiltrated biometric data and highlights regional cybersecurity maturity gaps.
  • A new group, 0APT, emerges with cryptographically strong ransomware binaries, despite initial victim claims being questioned.

🔍 New Techniques & Threat Research:

  • State-backed actors are actively leveraging Google Gemini AI for reconnaissance, vulnerability analysis, and malware development.
  • Ransomware groups are adopting stealthy tactics, using legitimate employee monitoring tools like Net Monitor for Employees Professional, chained with SimpleHelp RMM for network compromise.
  • Group-IB reports the industrialisation of supply chain attacks, with AI-assisted tools accelerating vulnerability scanning and identity attacks replacing traditional malware.

🔒 Exploited Vulnerabilities:

  • Apple rushes out updates for a critical zero-day (CVE-2026-20700) in dyld, actively exploited in sophisticated, targeted attacks.
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile zero-days (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) are seeing 83% of exploitation attempts from a single bulletproof hosting IP, consistent with initial access brokers.

📈 Broader Threat Landscape:

  • California fines Disney $2.75M for CCPA violations regarding data opt-out difficulties.
  • Hundreds of Chrome extensions found exfiltrating browsing history to data brokers.
  • CISA prepares for sector-specific town halls on the stalled CIRCIA regulation, seeking industry feedback.

item.title: Daily News Update: Thursday, February 12, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout: Your Daily Cyber Briefing üö®

Dive into the last 24 hours of cyber security with stdout! We unpack critical incidents including the ApolloMD data breach by Qilin ransomware, impacting over 620,000 individuals. Law enforcement action saw the arrest of a JokerOTP phishing-as-a-service operator linked to $10M in losses, while new payroll fraud schemes leverage social engineering against help desks to redirect paychecks, often bypassing detections via VDI. üí∏

Threat actors are evolving their tactics: discover how LummaStealer infections are surging via CastleLoader and the ClickFix technique. The Crazy ransomware gang is abusing legitimate tools like Net Monitor and SimpleHelp for persistence and evasion, and North Korea's UNC1069 deploys new macOS malware, deepfakes, and AI-generated video in crypto-theft campaigns. Plus, a new SSHStalker Linux botnet is using IRC for C2, brute-forcing, and 15-year-old kernel exploits. üõ†Ô∏è

Stay ahead of vulnerabilities: Microsoft's February Patch Tuesday addressed six actively exploited zero-days, including RCE flaws in Windows Shell, IE, and Word, all now in CISA's KEV. We also cover a critical Telnet vulnerability (CVE-2026-24061) with a CVSS 9.8, and a new Notepad Markdown RCE (CVE-2026-20841) requiring social engineering. ‚ö†Ô∏è

Finally, we analyse broader threat landscape insights, from the risks of posting AI-generated caricatures to the ongoing concerns around Telnet usage in the APAC region, and the data privacy implications of AI health apps. üõ°Ô∏è

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, February 11, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout: Your Daily Cyber Debrief üö®

Dive into the last 24 hours of cyber security with stdout! We're tracking active exploitation of SolarWinds Web Help Desk instances and the Warlock ransomware group's breach of SmarterTools via critical RCE (CVE-2026-24423) and authentication bypass (CVE-2026-23760) flaws. Discover how UNC3886 persistently breached Singaporean telcos with a zero-day for espionage, and the widespread impact of Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile zero-days (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) on European government agencies, exposing employee data. Plus, a destructive Russian-backed attack on Poland's energy grid and the SafePay ransomware link to the Volvo Group NA data exposure via Conduent.

Unpack new threat actor tactics, including UNC1069's sophisticated social engineering, deepfake CEO, and multi-stage malware (WAVESHAPER, HYPERCALL, DEEPBREATH, CHROMEPUSH) targeting a crypto executive. Learn about TeamPCP's worm-like attacks exploiting misconfigured cloud services (Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, React2Shell) across 60,000+ servers for cryptomining and data theft. We also cover the emergence of ZeroDayRAT, a new commercial mobile spyware, and how malicious prompts can trick AI agents in messaging apps into data-leaking URLs. Beware of trojanised 7-Zip installers turning systems into residential proxy nodes and state-linked phishing campaigns targeting high-profile European figures.

Stay ahead with critical vulnerability updates: Microsoft's February Patch Tuesday addressed 58 flaws, including six actively exploited zero-days and three public disclosures. Fortinet has also patched a critical SQL Injection vulnerability (CVE-2026-21643, CVSS 9.1) in FortiClientEMS, allowing unauthenticated RCE. The latest Picus Labs Red Report highlights a strategic shift from loud ransomware to stealthy, long-term access, with a focus on data extortion and evasion. We also delve into the evolving threat of "process comprehension" in OT cyberattacks and the ongoing debate around FISA Section 702 renewal. Finally, Microsoft rolls out new mobile-style security controls for Windows 11 and updates Secure Boot certificates.

item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, February 10, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üö®

Unpacking the latest in cyber security: European government entities are reeling from Ivanti zero-day exploits (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340), while ransomware hits Senegal's national ID office, US payment providers, and SmarterTools. SolarWinds Web Help Desk RCEs (CVE-2025-40551, CVE-2025-26399) are under active exploitation, with attackers utilising legitimate tools for persistence. üí•

New threat intelligence reveals China's "Expedition Cloud" platform for critical infrastructure cyberattack rehearsals and TeamPCP's (DeadCatx3) "massive campaign" targeting cloud-native environments with worm-driven exploits. Discover the emergence of Amaranth-Dragon, a new Chinese cyber espionage group linked to APT-41, and UNC3886's covert access into Singaporean telcos. üá®üá≥

A deep-dive into vulnerabilities covers a critical BeyondTrust RCE (CVE-2026-1731), multiple SmarterMail flaws added to CISA's KEV catalogue, and over 50,000 internet-exposed OpenClaw instances vulnerable to RCE. We also unpack the systemic challenges of AI security beyond cloud infrastructure and how modern compilers can inadvertently reintroduce side-channel vulnerabilities. üõ†Ô∏è

In broader news, Bunnings successfully challenged a privacy violation over facial recognition, India proposes "Digital Identities" for AI agents, and China tightens its cryptocurrency ban. Plus, Russia grants asylum to an alleged Spanish "cyberterrorist" wanted for espionage. üá¶üá∫

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, February 9, 2026
item.description:
üö® Critical Alert: OpenClaw & Shadow AI Risks Unpacked! üö®

This episode of stdout dives deep into the alarming security landscape surrounding OpenClaw, the open-source AI agent, and its marketplace, ClawHub. We unpack hundreds of malicious skills designed for data exfiltration, backdoor injection, and stealer malware, alongside critical vulnerabilities including one-click Remote Code Execution (RCE) and zero-click attacks via indirect prompt injection. Discover how cleartext credentials, API keys, and over 30,000 exposed OpenClaw instances are creating new attack surfaces, highlighting the significant "Shadow AI" risk. We also cover the adjacent Moltbook social network's misconfigured database, exposing 1.5 million API tokens and 35,000 email addresses.

We discuss OpenClaw's response, including the integration of VirusTotal scanning for all uploaded skills, and then shift gears to a powerful new open-source tool: Tirith. üõ°Ô∏è

Learn how Tirith is revolutionising command-line security by hooking into user shells (zsh, bash, fish, PowerShell) to inspect and block malicious URLs. We detail its effectiveness against homograph attacks, terminal injection, pipe-to-shell patterns, dotfile hijacking, insecure transport, typosquatted git repositories, and credential exposure in URLs. Best of all, Tirith performs all analysis locally, ensuring privacy and minimal overhead. Get the lowdown on this essential cross-platform defence tool!

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, February 8, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üö®

Stay ahead with the latest 24-hour cyber developments! We dissect a sophisticated state-sponsored phishing campaign using Signal's social engineering to target high-ranking officials across Europe, linked to Russia-aligned groups. Additionally, a new audit probes the Department of Homeland Security's collection and management of Personally Identifiable Information and biometric data, following allegations of broad surveillance and facial recognition expansion. üõ°Ô∏è

item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, February 7, 2026
item.description:
üö® **stdout Daily Briefing: Active Threats & Breaches** üö®

Dive into the latest cyber developments! We're tracking a breach at Spain's Ministry of Science via an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability and a Qilin ransomware attack on Romania's national oil pipeline operator, Conpet. An Illinois man pleaded guilty to hacking 600 Snapchat accounts, while the Asian state-backed TGR-STA-1030 group has breached over 70 government and critical infrastructure organisations globally using phishing and N-day exploits. Plus, Norway confirms Chinese state-sponsored Salt Typhoon activity, and Germany warns of Signal account hijacking targeting high-ranking individuals.

üõ†Ô∏è **New Techniques & Threat Actor Tactics** üõ†Ô∏è

Discover how ransomware operators like LockBit and Qilin are abusing ISPsystem VMmanager's default Windows templates for payload delivery. Threat actors are weaponising the legitimate, albeit expired, EnCase kernel driver to disable EDR products, exploiting a Driver Signature Enforcement gap. Unpack DKnife, a China-nexus framework performing deep packet inspection and traffic manipulation via routers, and get the latest on DDoS trends, including a record 31.4 Tbps attack and the rise of "smash-and-dash" tactics.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Exploited Vulnerabilities & AI Risks** ‚ö†Ô∏è

CISA has issued a critical warning for CVE-2026-24423, an actively exploited Remote Code Execution (RCE) flaw in SmarterMail. We also explore significant risks in AI agent platforms: Moltbook exposed user secrets and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) via an unauthenticated API key, while OpenClaw's marketplace revealed sensitive credentials in over 7% of its skills. Learn about indirect prompt injection attacks and the broader implications of these agentic network vulnerabilities.

üõ°Ô∏è **Defensive Insights & Regulatory Updates** üõ°Ô∏è

On the defensive front, Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.6 has autonomously discovered over 500 previously unknown high-severity vulnerabilities in open-source libraries. We also look at KEV Collider, a new tool to help organisations better triage CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalogue, and CISA's Binding Operational Directive 26-02, mandating federal agencies to remove end-of-life network edge devices to mitigate substantial exploitation risks.

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, February 6, 2026
item.description:
Dive into the latest cyber skirmishes! üí• This episode uncovers significant breaches at Substack and Betterment, exposing millions of user details via social engineering and dating back to October 2025. We track Qilin ransomware's hit on Romania's Conpet, a suspected pro-Russian attack on Italy's La Sapienza University, and broader 'Russian origin' cyberattacks targeting Italian interests. Plus, discover how threat actors are hijacking NGINX servers with malicious config injections and exploiting unsecured Zendesk systems for spam campaigns.

Unpack cutting-edge threats and tactics. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è APT28 (Fancy Bear) is exploiting a new Microsoft Office vulnerability (CVE-2026-21509) with MiniDoor malware, while the Asia-based TGR-STA-1030 group leverages a new Linux kernel rootkit, ShadowGuard, in a vast cyberespionage operation. We also explore an AWS cloud intrusion achieving admin access in minutes, potentially with AI assistance, and DragonForce ransomware's shift to a 'cartel' model. Discover Iranian IRGC spear-phishing, Microsoft's LLM 'sleeper agent' detection, the pervasive SystemBC botnet, and BYOVD attacks abusing revoked kernel drivers. Plus, a critical coding error in Nitrogen ransomware causing irreversible data loss.

On the vulnerability front, üö® critical flaws (CVE-2026-25049) in the n8n open-source workflow automation platform allow remote code execution and full host control, with PoCs publicly available. GitHub Codespaces has disclosed attack vectors enabling RCE by simply opening malicious repositories, a behaviour Microsoft currently deems 'by design.' We also cover a critical sandbox escape (CVE-2025-64721) in Sandboxie, now patched.

Finally, we examine the broader threat landscape and regulatory shifts. üìà GreyNoise research reveals CISA silently updated 59 KEV entries for ransomware use, challenging patch prioritisation. Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system security is gaining board-level focus, with ransomware operations increasingly targeting these 'crown jewel' assets. CISA has also issued a binding directive for federal agencies to replace unsupported 'edge devices' within twelve months, and Microsoft is mandating TLS 1.2 for Azure Blob Storage by February 2026.

item.title: Daily News Update: Thursday, February 5, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout Daily Brief: Your essential 24-hour intel drop for Cyber Security Analysts, covering 20 critical stories across 8 topics. Today, we dive into active cyber events, emerging threats, and urgent vulnerability patches.

üí• Breaches & Attacks: The US military digitally disrupted Iranian air missile defence systems in Operation Midnight Hammer. Step Finance lost $40M from compromised executive devices, while Coinbase confirmed a new insider breach affecting ~30 customers. The Mexican government faces 2.3TB data leak allegations from Chronus Group, though claims are downplayed. Ivanti EPMM is under active attack via critical zero-days (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340), and ransomware gangs are now exploiting VMware ESXi sandbox escape (CVE-2025-22225).

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è New Techniques & Research: Russia's APT28 (Fancy Bear) rapidly exploited CVE-2026-21509 (MS Office bypass) within three days, deploying MiniDoor and Covenant Grunt. Python-based infostealers are expanding to macOS via fake ads, and Predator spyware can now block iOS camera/mic indicators. Discover an EDR killer abusing a revoked EnCase kernel driver, and learn why Nitrogen ransomware's ESXi variant has a critical decryption flaw. AI agents are significantly assisting criminals in vuln scanning and malware writing, but Gartner warns against "insecure by default" OpenClaw-as-a-service. ‚ö†Ô∏è

ü©π Critical Vulnerabilities: CISA mandates patching for actively exploited SolarWinds Web Help Desk RCE (CVE-2025-40551) and a 5-year-old GitLab SSRF (CVE-2021-39935). Ivanti EPMM zero-days (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) allow unauthenticated RCE, with CVE-2026-1281 added to the KEV catalog. Google Looker patched SQLi and RCE flaws, while VMware ESXi sandbox escape (CVE-2025-22225) and Sangoma FreePBX vulnerabilities (CVE-2019-19006, CVE-2025-64328) are also under CISA's urgent patch orders. ‚è∞

üåê Industry & Regulatory: The Eclipse Foundation will enforce pre-publication security checks for Open VSX Registry extensions. DHS is revamping critical infrastructure partnerships, and CISA is considering an AI Information Sharing and Analysis Centre. Microsoft is rolling out native Sysmon functionality to Windows 11 Insiders, and Ukraine has implemented a Starlink "whitelist" to counter Russian drone use. üîí

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, February 4, 2026
item.description:
üéß stdout delivers your daily deep dive into the latest in information security for Cyber Security Analysts. We've got the essential updates from the last 24 hours, covering active cyber events, novel techniques, and critical exploited vulnerabilities.

üö® **Active Threats & Breaches:** We unpack a sophisticated Dropbox phishing campaign harvesting credentials via fake PDF lures hosted on legitimate cloud services. Get the details on the Iron Mountain breach, where the Everest extortion gang claimed 1.4TB, though the company reports a limited incident involving marketing materials accessed via compromised credentials. Plus, a 20-year-old has been arrested in Poland for operating a global DDoS botnet, and a Polish defence ministry employee detained on suspicion of spying for Russian and Belarusian intelligence. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

‚õìÔ∏è **New Techniques & Supply Chain Attacks:** Stay ahead of emerging attack vectors with insights into the new GlassWorm macOS malware, targeting systems via compromised OpenVSX extensions to steal passwords, crypto-wallet data, and developer credentials. We also detail the China-linked Lotus Blossom group's Notepad++ supply chain attack, which delivered the stealthy Chrysalis backdoor through trojanised updates, exploiting insufficient verification controls in older versions.

üí• **Actively Exploited Vulnerabilities:** Our deep dive reveals Russian APT28 (Fancy Bear) leveraging a recently patched Microsoft Office zero-day (CVE-2026-21509) against Ukrainian government and EU organisations. Learn about the critical React Native Metro RCE (CVE-2025-11953), allowing unauthenticated command execution and EDR-disabling payloads, despite its low Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) score. CISA has also flagged a critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk RCE (CVE-2025-40551), demanding urgent federal agency patching. We also expose the "dumpster fire" that is the OpenClaw DIY AI bot farm, riddled with high-impact RCE and command injection flaws, alongside exposed API keys from the Moltbook project.

üåê **Threat Landscape & Regulatory Scrutiny:** We discuss the critical impact of recent major cloud service outages on identity systems and Zero Trust models, disrupting authentication and authorisation. Uncover CISA's silent updates to its Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) catalog regarding ransomware use, and a coordinated reconnaissance campaign targeting Citrix NetScaler infrastructure. In regulatory news, X and Grok AI face intense scrutiny and raids in France and the UK over alleged generation of illicit content, while the UK investigates its first suspected cyber sanctions breaches.

item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, February 3, 2026
item.description:
This stdout episode unpacks a busy 24 hours in infosec, tracking critical supply chain compromises and active cyber events. State-sponsored actors hijacked Notepad++ and eScan antivirus update mechanisms, while a malicious update push via the Open VSX Registry delivered GlassWorm malware. We also cover the NationStates data breach via a one-click RCE, and a Belgian high school's data theft followed by attempted parent extortion. üí•

Dive into new threat intelligence: North Korea's Labyrinth Chollima has splintered into specialised entities for crypto theft and espionage. We reveal over 230 malicious "skills" found in the OpenClaw AI assistant registry, deploying info-stealing malware. On the vulnerability front, Russia-linked APT28 is actively exploiting a new Microsoft Office zero-day (CVE-2026-21509), and a critical one-click RCE was patched in the OpenClaw AI ecosystem. üõ°Ô∏è

Our analysis extends to the broader threat landscape, highlighting over 175,000 exposed Ollama open-source AI deployments ripe for exploitation, and the increasing trend of infrastructure cyberattacks. We discuss the perils of the "move fast and break things" software culture and Microsoft's plan to phase out the vulnerable NTLM authentication protocol. Plus, a critical shutdown bug affecting some Windows 10/11 devices post-January updates. üíª

Finally, we cover significant data privacy and regulatory news: the US Treasury's termination of contracts with Booz Allen Hamilton due to data safeguards failure, McDonald's push for better password hygiene, and a simulated breach of South Korean government systems. We also touch on the $600,000 settlement for security professionals wrongfully arrested during a legitimate pen test. Stay informed! üá¶üá∫

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, February 2, 2026
item.description:
üö® Urgent warning: Dive into ongoing data extortion attacks targeting misconfigured MongoDB instances. item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, January 31, 2026
item.description:
üö® Active Cyber Events & Breaches: A former Google engineer has been convicted for economic espionage and theft of over 2,000 AI trade secrets. Dating giants Bumble and Match Group are investigating claims of data breaches by the ShinyHunters group. Google, Cloudflare, and partners successfully disrupted IPIDEA, a massive China-based residential proxy network, reducing its operational capacity by 40%. We also cover a police probe into potential obstruction of a data breach investigation affecting 33.7 million Coupang customer accounts in South Korea, major anti-piracy operations by Europol and the US DoJ, and further notifications stemming from the TriZetto Provider Solutions health data exposure. Plus, illicit cryptocurrency flows hit a record $158 billion in 2025, driven by sanctions-linked activity and nation-state use.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è New Threats & Exploited Vulnerabilities: Bitdefender researchers uncovered an Android malware campaign leveraging Hugging Face as a repository for thousands of APK payloads, exploiting Accessibility Services for credential theft with server-side polymorphism. Trend Micro details China-linked Advanced Persistent Threat groups utilising the sophisticated PeckBirdy command-and-control framework in watering-hole attacks and espionage. Cisco Talos identifies a new campaign by China-linked actor UAT-8099 targeting vulnerable Internet Information Services (IIS) servers in Asia with web shells and custom BadIIS SEO malware. ‚ö†Ô∏è Ivanti disclosed and patched two critical, actively exploited zero-day code-injection flaws (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), allowing unauthenticated remote code execution. üïµÔ∏è **New Techniques:** North Korea's Konni APT group is deploying AI-generated PowerShell malware via spear-phishing, targeting blockchain developers in Australia, Japan, and India.
ü©π **Critical Vulnerabilities:** CISA added a critical VMware vCenter Server Remote Code Execution flaw (CVE-2024-37079) to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalogue, with Broadcom confirming active exploitation. Shadowserver tracks nearly 800,000 internet-exposed Telnet servers, many vulnerable to CVE-2026-24061, an actively exploited authentication bypass allowing unauthenticated root login. Microsoft issued emergency out-of-band updates for an actively exploited Office zero-day (CVE-2026-21509). Koi Security also identified "PackageGate" flaws in JavaScript package managers, bypassing supply-chain defences, though npm declined a fix. Pwn2Own Automotive 2026 uncovered 76 zero-days in automotive systems, including Tesla infotainment.
üìà **Industry Trends & Regulatory Shifts:** The increasing sophistication of AI-based attacks highlights the need for a combined Network Detection and Response (NDR) and Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) defence strategy. The Supreme Court will hear Salazar v. Paramount Global, questioning Facebook tracking pixel legality under the Video Privacy Protection Act. The European Commission launched a formal investigation into X and its Grok chatbot under the Digital Services Act, concerning the generation and spread of sexually explicit images, including child sexual abuse material. The international Pall Mall Process is developing voluntary industry guidelines for commercial cyber intrusion tools. The UK government plans an in-house digital identity scheme, dropping the compulsory element. Cloudflare reported a 25-minute BGP route leak on January 22nd, affecting IPv6 traffic due to an accidental policy misconfiguration.

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, December 28, 2025
item.description: Dive into the latest cyber security developments with stdout. Today, we unpack a high-severity vulnerability impacting MongoDB: CVE-2025-14847. Rated CVSS 8.7, this flaw allows unauthenticated clients to read uninitialised heap memory, potentially exposing sensitive in-memory data. üö® We analyse the technical specifics: the issue stems from improper handling of length parameter inconsistency within Zlib compressed protocol headers. Mismatched length fields can lead to the disclosure of internal state information or pointers, which could significantly aid further exploitation. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Are your MongoDB deployments at risk? We detail the affected versions, including 8.2.0-8.2.3, 8.0.0-8.0.16, 7.0.0-7.0.26, 6.0.0-6.0.26, 5.0.0-5.0.31, 4.4.0-4.4.29, and all 4.2, 4.0, and 3.6 series. ‚ö†Ô∏è Crucially, patches are available in versions 8.2.3, 8.0.17, 7.0.28, 6.0.27, 5.0.32, and 4.4.30. If immediate patching isn't feasible, we discuss the recommended mitigation: disabling zlib compression on your MongoDB Server. üõ†Ô∏è

item.description:
üá¶üá∫ stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üá¶üá∫

Today, we unpack a critical development for cybersecurity analysts: Portugal's new legal safe harbour for good-faith security research. üõ°Ô∏è This pivotal policy update, Article 8.o-A, now exempts ethical vulnerability detection from previous cybercrime classifications, empowering researchers to uncover exploitable weaknesses without legal fear. üîç

We detail the strict conditions governing this exemption, including immediate disclosure, no economic benefit beyond professional compensation, and prohibitions against service disruption or data harm. This move aims to foster proactive identification of vulnerabilities and improve overall cyber resilience. üöÄ

üåê Threat Landscape & Strategic Shifts: A new report highlights AI-powered attacks, large-scale JavaScript injection, and surging Magecart as key threats reshaping web security. item.description: stdout unpacks the last 24 hours in cyber security. We dive into the FBI's FLASH alert on UNC6040/UNC6395 (ShinyHunters/Scattered Spider) compromising Salesforce via vishing and OAuth token exploits, alongside ongoing disruption at Jaguar Land Rover and a ransomware attack forcing a Texas school district closure. Discover how Akira ransomware bypassed MFA in a SonicWall VPN breach using plaintext recovery codes, and the largest npm supply chain compromise to date, impacting billions of downloads after a maintainer was phished. We also cover new SEO poisoning campaigns distributing novel malware, Mustang Panda's updated TONESHELL and geofenced SnakeDisk worm, and Kimsuky spies leveraging ChatGPT for fake IDs. Plus, a new Rowhammer attack variant, "Phoenix," bypasses DDR5 defences to achieve root privileges, and Microsoft warns about SMBv1 connection issues. Stay informed on these critical developments.

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, September 17, 2025
item.description: stdout unpacks the latest in cyber security: Jaguar Land Rover's operations remain suspended following a 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' attack, with the group also creating a fraudulent account in Google's LERS portal. We detail 'Shai-Hulud,' a self-propagating npm worm actively stealing credentials, and the 'FileFix' social engineering technique delivering the StealC infostealer via fake Facebook alerts and steganography. Explore the massive 'SlopAds' ad fraud operation exploiting Android apps, plus the new 'Phoenix' RowHammer variant bypassing DDR5 memory protections. Apple has backported patches for an actively exploited Image I/O zero-day. Also, China's stricter incident reporting mandates, Microsoft's removal of WMIC, and Check Point's acquisition of AI security platform Lakera.
